articles.title: Five things we still don't know about the coronavirus
articles.description: Despite extensive study by doctors and scientists across the world since the new coronavirus first appeared in China three months ago, much about the scourge is still unclear.
articles.content:
Despite extensive study by doctors and scientists across the world since the new coronavirus first appeared in China three months ago, much about the virus is still unclear.

articles.title: Rothschild warns of financial hit from coronavirus
articles.description: Rothschild, the historic banking and financial services firm whose alumni include French President Emmanuel Macron, has warned of a hit to its results as the coronavirus crisis hits global businesses and markets.

articles.title: IKEA making masks to help fight coronavirus
articles.description: Furniture giant IKEA is producing face masks and other protective gear for hospitals, joining a growing list of companies branching out of their normal business areas to help meet equipment shortages in the fight against coronavirus.
articles.content:
Furniture giant IKEA said it is producing face masks and other protective gear for hospitals.
It joins a growing list of companies branching out of their normal business areas to help meet equipment shortages in the fight against coronavirus.

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Global M&A dwindles as coronavirus batters economies
articles.description: Global mergers and acquisitions activity plunged 28% in the first quarter to its lowest level since 2016 as the devastating economic effects of the coronavirus pandemic took hold in March.
articles.content:
Global mergers and acquisitions activity plunged 28% in the first quarter to its lowest level since 2016 as the devastating economic effects of the coronavirus pandemic took hold in March.
This only compounded a slow start to the year for dealmakers.

articles.description: With the coronavirus crisis impacting across all sport, the GAA have been forced to bring in a range of pay cuts for staff.

articles.title: Rugby Australia slashes jobs as coronavirus bites
articles.description: Rugby Australia has stood down 75% of its workforce for the next three months and offered the remaining staff significant salary reductions or reduced hours.

articles.description: Seventeen more people have died from Covid-19 in Ireland and 325 new cases have been diagnosed today.
